CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 15, 1955, pg. 19 reads: "New Homes Offered To Negroes-Here are two of the new homes which have been erected for Negroes in Hill District this year. These two homes, built by Ballon and Vetter, members of Private Housing, Inc., are located on Bedford Avenue near Watt Street.  These homes are part of a pilot project undertaken by the Home Builders of Metropolitan Pittsburgh to test the potentialities of the market for new housing among Negroes."
TitMainTitle: Two newly constructed two story brick houses, one on left with diamond shaped decorations on second story, Hill District
